content: COX-2 inhibitor non-steroidal anti-inflammatory agent (NSAIA) for analgesia and fever reduction
Used by All Service Members (ASM), Combat Lifesavers (CLS) and Combat Medics (CM)
For mild to moderate pain management with a casualty that is still able to fight.
NSAIA or salicylate hypersensitivity, asthma, severe renal or hepatic disease, potential benefits may warrant use of the drug in pregnant women despite potential risks if the alternative is worse
Edema, flu-like syndrome, abdominal pain, diarrhea, dyspepsia, nausea, ulceration, GI bleed, anemia, headache or insomnia
Decreased effect of ACE inhibitors and diuretics, increased lithium levels and toxicity, increased GI bleed risk with aspirin and warfarin
TACTICAL CONSIDERATIONS: Minimal to no mission impact; DO NOT give to K-9 casualties.
